content: yarn dragon beanie designed by jeananne atthowe her emerald and deep purple scales shimmer as she spreads her wings to take flight the villagers have left gifts for her in their fields her fiery heart is joyous at the sight of enormous balls of yarn in every direction this is her favorite time of year she carefully gathers each ball and carries them to her hoard delighting in the fibers colors and craftsmanship of each one materials & notes difficulty finished measurements inches/cm intermediate 21 in circumference x 8 5 tall 53 3 cm x 21 6 cm yarn additional notes 301 yards 275 meters of worsted weight the yarn dragon beanie is worked top-down and in the outcast relics worsted weight 100% merino 1 round by joining each round with a slip_stitch skein 218 yards 311 meters and 100 grams 3 5 ounces per skein main color emerald 1 skein 218 yards 199 meters color a dusky evenfall 1 skein 83 yards 76 meters hook us size i/9 5 50 mm other materials & tools tapestry needle scissors pom-pom optional gauge in pattern after completing round 7 the diameter of your hat s crown when laid flat should measure 6 5 inches 16 5 cm stitch abbreviations & explanations chain chain round s round s mc magic_ring magic loop magic_ring single_crochet single_crochet make a loop with the yarn around your fingers with the tail end of the yarn behind the working yarn the yarn coming slip_stitch slip_stitch from the skein leaving a tail about 6 inches long hold the place where the yarn overlaps between your thumb st s stitch es and forefinger insert your hook through the loop and bring through a loop of the working yarn one loop is now on the yo yarn over hook chain the appropriate number of sts for the st that will be worked into the mc e g 3 chs for a half_double_crochet work the special stitches desired number of sts around the ring working over both the working yarn and the tail so that the tail can be pulled to fp-puff front post puff close the circle when all stitches are completed working around the post of the indicated st from front to back *yo insert hook into the stitch and pull up one loop puff repeat from * twice working into the same stitch being *yo insert hook into the stitch and pull up one loop repeat careful to keep the loops loose there should now be seven from * twice working into the same stitch being careful to loops on the hook yo and draw the yarn through six loops keep the loops loose there should now be seven loops on the yo and draw the yarn through both loops on the hook hook yo and draw the yarn through six loops yo and draw the yarn through the remaining two loops on the hook © 2021 cerulean orchid all rights reserved yarn dragon beanie | 2 pattern
